title: Golden Globes 2025: Complete Winners List (Updating Live)
description: The 2025 awards season has officially begun, with the Golden Globes kicking things off Sunday night. Unlike last year, which was dominated by “Oppenheimer,” prognosticators indicate that there is no clear frontrunner for the 2025 season. In recent weeks, Universal’s “Wicked” has dominated social media, with fans attending singalong screenings over Christmas. Netflix’s “Emilia Perez” […]
author: Jordan Moreau
excerpt: See all the Golden Globe 2025 winners.
text: The 2025 awards season has officially begun, with the Golden Globes kicking things off Sunday night. Unlike last year, which was dominated by “Oppenheimer,” prognosticators indicate that there is no clear frontrunner for the 2025 season. In recent weeks, Universal’s “Wicked” has dominated social media, with fans attending singalong screenings over Christmas. Netflix’s “Emilia Perez” leads the Golden Globes field with 10 nods. The two musicals are nominated alongside a competitive field rounded out by “Anora,” “Challengers,” “The Substance” and “A Real Pain” in the comedy or musical category. In the drama race, A24’s sweeping epic “The Brutalist” leads with seven nods. It’s followed closely by Focus Features’ papal drama “Conclave,” with six nods. Their fellow nominees are “A Complete Unknown,” “Dune: Part Two,” “Nickel Boys” and “September 5.” On the TV side, FX’s restaurant dramedy “The Bear” leads with five nominations. It’ll go up against Hulu’s “Only Murders in the Building,” which earned four nods, while FX’s “Shogun” tops the drama races with four nominations. See the winners below as they’re announced. BEST MOTION PICTURE – DRAMA THE BRUTALIST (A24) A COMPLETE UNKNOWN (Searchlight Pictures) CONCLAVE (Focus Features) DUNE: PART TWO (Warner Bros. Pictures) NICKEL BOYS (Orion Pictures / Amazon MGM Studios) SEPTEMBER 5 (Paramount Pictures) BEST MOTION PICTURE – MUSICAL OR COMEDY ANORA (NEON) CHALLENGERS (Amazon MGM Studios) EMILIA PÉREZ (Netflix) A REAL PAIN (Searchlight Pictures) THE SUBSTANCE (MUBI) WICKED (Universal Pictures) BEST MOTION PICTURE – ANIMATED FLOW (Sideshow / Janus Films) INSIDE OUT 2 (Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures) MEMOIR OF A SNAIL (IFC Films) MOANA 2 (Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures) WALLACE & GROMIT: VENGEANCE MOST FOWL (Netflix) THE WILD ROBOT (Universal Pictures) CINEMATIC AND BOX OFFICE ACHIEVEMENT ALIEN: ROMULUS (Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures) BEETLEJUICE BEETLEJUICE (Warner Bros. html:
The 2025 awards season has officially begun, with the Golden Globes kicking things off Sunday night.

Unlike last year, which was dominated by “Oppenheimer,” prognosticators indicate that there is no clear frontrunner for the 2025 season. In recent weeks, Universal’s “Wicked” has dominated social media, with fans attending singalong screenings over Christmas. Netflix’s “Emilia Perez” leads the Golden Globes field with 10 nods. The two musicals are nominated alongside a competitive field rounded out by “Anora,” “Challengers,” “The Substance” and “A Real Pain” in the comedy or musical category.

In the drama race, A24’s sweeping epic “The Brutalist” leads with seven nods. It’s followed closely by Focus Features’ papal drama “Conclave,” with six nods. Their fellow nominees are “A Complete Unknown,” “Dune: Part Two,” “Nickel Boys” and “September 5.”

On the TV side, FX’s restaurant dramedy “The Bear” leads with five nominations. It’ll go up against Hulu’s “Only Murders in the Building,” which earned four nods, while FX’s “Shogun” tops the drama races with four nominations.

See the winners below as they’re announced.

BEST MOTION PICTURE – DRAMA

THE BRUTALIST (A24)

A COMPLETE UNKNOWN (Searchlight Pictures)

CONCLAVE (Focus Features)

DUNE: PART TWO (Warner Bros. Pictures)

NICKEL BOYS (Orion Pictures / Amazon MGM Studios)

SEPTEMBER 5 (Paramount Pictures)

BEST MOTION PICTURE – MUSICAL OR COMEDY

ANORA (NEON)

CHALLENGERS (Amazon MGM Studios)

EMILIA PÉREZ (Netflix)

A REAL PAIN (Searchlight Pictures)

THE SUBSTANCE (MUBI)

WICKED (Universal Pictures)

BEST MOTION PICTURE – ANIMATED
